result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James T Wegert

records.addlTxt:
12:12 PM Defendant James T Wegert in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for James T Wegert.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is reset for plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

12:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James T Wegert in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for James T Wegert.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: def not revoked, needs time to discuss.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James T Wegert in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for James T Wegert.  Atty Erdman updates- def has been housed in Barron County (allows in-person visitation only), has not been able to contact him and discuss a waiver.  Discussion of waiver, Court explains to def.  Def indicates he wishes to waive the prelim.  Case proceeds to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing: Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint. Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Atty Erdman requests additional status conference.
Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.

3:12 PM Defendant James T Wegert appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by phone for James T Wegert. Court will not move forward today by video because the Barron County Jail can't accommodate a confidential breakout session at this time.  Court resets.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 20, 2022 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:

Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for James T Wegert. Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Requests STC instead of prelim for next hearing.  Def on probation hold.  WTLPH.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
